clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Response of Itraconazole and Terbinafine Therapy in Subjects With Crohn's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Response of Itraconazole and Terbinafine Therapy in Subjects With Crohn's Disease Not Responding Adequately to Current Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the response of itraconazole and terbinafine therapy compared to placebo in patients with Crohn's disease (CD).

detailed_description.textblock: This multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebocontrolled, phase II, proof of concept study will randomize 68 subjects at 2 to 4 clinical sites in Canada. Following signature of informed consent, subjects who meet entry criteria will be randomized in a 1:1 ratio to receive either itraconazole and terbinafine, or matching placebos. During the first 4 weeks subjects will receive itraconazole 200 mg twice daily or matching placebo, followed by itraconazole 200 mg twice daily and terbinafine 250 mg twice daily or matching placebos for the remaining 16 weeks. The 2 drugs will be administered orally.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the response of itraconazole and terbinafine therapy compared to placebo in subjects with CD, assessed by the Modified Harvey Bradshaw Index (HBI).
primary_outcome.description: Clinical response defined as a decrease from baseline to end of treatment in Modified Harvey Bradshaw HBI score from 0 to greater than 16 (it will depend on the number of soft stools per day). The higher the score the worse the outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the response of the itraconazole and terbinafine therapy compared to placebo in subjects with CD on clinical remission assessed by the HBI.
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission defined as an Modified Harvey Bradshaw Index (HBI) at end of treatment ≤ 4 points.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the endoscopic response of the itraconazole and terbinafine therapy compared to placebo in subjects with CD as assessed by the Simplified Endoscopic Score for Crohn's disease (SES-CD).
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic response defined as the change from baseline to end of treatment in Simplified Endoscopic Score for Crohn's Disease (SES-CD). Score from 0 to 60. The higher the score the worse the outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the response to treatment of the itraconazole and terbinafine therapy compared to placebo in subjects with CD on FC levels.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to end of treatment in faecal calprotectin (FC) levels

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the response to treatment of the itraconazole and terbinafine therapy compared to placebo in subjects with CD assessed by the HBI.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to end of treatment in HBI.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the response to treatment of the itraconazole and terbinafine therapy compared to placebo in subjects with CD on inflammatory markers.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to end of treatment in C-reactive protein (CRP) levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the response to treatment of the itraconazole and terbinafine therapy compared to placebo in subjects with CD on serology markers.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to end of treatment in Anti-Saccharomyces cerevisiae antibodies (ASCA) levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the response to treatment of the itraconazole and terbinafine therapy compared to placebo in subjects with CD on serology markers.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to 8 weeks post end of treatment in ASCA levels.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory analyses using genetic data will be described at a later time point and in a separate document.
other_outcome.description: To determine the link between the genetic and the response to therapy and inflammation, the microbiote genes will be evaluated.

other_outcome.measure: To evaluate steroid use between active and placebo groups at study completion.
other_outcome.description: Steroid Use in Subjects with Crohn's Disease will be reported as the proportion of subjects who's steroid use was decreased. increased, changed or stopped.

arm_group.description: During the first 4 weeks itraconazole will be administered alone at 200 mg twice daily, followed by itraconazole 200 mg twice daily and terbinafine 250 mg twice daily for the remaining 16 weeks. Both drugs will be administered orally.

During the first 4 weeks a placebo will be administered alone at 200 mg twice daily, followed by placebo 200 mg twice daily and another placebo 250 mg twice daily for the remaining 16 weeks. Both placebos will be administered orally.
